api:generate.description:
Prepares your environment for custom queries development. run it from your root directory!
                        Creates all necessary files and scripts
                        to start working with custom api queries and mutations.
                        Read the documentation at [@mondaydotcomorg/setup-api](https://github.com/mondaycom/monday-graphql-api/tree/main/packages/setup-api)

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).

examples: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> -a APP_ID -i APP_VERSION_ID -d APP_FEATURE_ID  -t BUILD_TYPE -u CUSTOM_URL

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

appVersionId.description: Please enter the app version id of your app:
appVersionId.name: appVersionId

appFeatureId.description: Please enter the app feature id of your app:
appFeatureId.name: appFeatureId

print-command.name: print-command

appVersionId.name: appVersionId

app:deploy.description: Deploy an app using manifest file.

print-command.name: print-command

directoryPath.description: Directory path of you project in your machine. If not included will use the current working directory.
directoryPath.name: directoryPath

appId.description: App id (will use the latest draft version)
appId.name: appId

force.description: Force push to latest version (draft or live)
force.name: force

code:env.description: Manage environment variables for your app hosted on monday-code.

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

appId.description: The id of the app to manage environment variables for
appId.name: appId

key.description: variable key [required for set and delete]]
key.name: key

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

appVersionId.description: Please enter the app version id of your app:
appVersionId.name: appVersionId

logsType.description: Logs type: "http" for http events, "console" for stdout
logsType.name: logsType

eventSource.description: Source: "live" for live events, "History" for fetching events from the past
eventSource.name: eventSource

logsStartDate.description: Start date (MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm) e.g. "03/24/1983 15:45" [supported only if eventSource=live]
logsStartDate.name: logsStartDate

logsEndDate.description: End date (MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm) e.g. "03/25/1983 16:45" [supported only if eventSource=live]
logsEndDate.name: logsEndDate

logSearchFromText.description: text: a text in regex that will be searched among the logs text [supported only if eventSource=live]
logSearchFromText.name: logSearchFromText

code:push.description: Push your project to get hosted on monday-code.
examples: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> -d PROJECT DIRECTORY PATH -i APP_VERSION_ID_TO_PUSH

print-command.name: print-command

scheduler:create.description: Create a new scheduler job for an app

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

schedule.description: Cron expression for the job schedule (relative to UTC)
schedule.name: schedule

targetUrl.description: Target URL path for the job endpoint (will be relative to /mndy-cronjob/<YOUR_ENDPOINT>)
targetUrl.name: targetUrl

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries for failed jobs (optional)
maxRetries.name: maxRetries

minBackoffDuration.description: Minimum backoff duration in seconds between retries (optional)
minBackoffDuration.name: minBackoffDuration

scheduler:delete.description: Delete a scheduler job for an app

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

scheduler:list.description: List all scheduler jobs for an app

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

scheduler:run.description: Manually trigger a scheduled job to run for an app

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

scheduler:update.description: Update a scheduler job for an app

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

schedule.description: Cron expression for the job schedule (relative to UTC)
schedule.name: schedule

targetUrl.description: Target URL path for the job endpoint (will be relative to /mndy-cronjob/<YOUR_ENDPOINT>)
targetUrl.name: targetUrl

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries for failed jobs (optional)
maxRetries.name: maxRetries

minBackoffDuration.description: Minimum backoff duration in seconds between retries (optional)
minBackoffDuration.name: minBackoffDuration

storage:export.description: Export all keys and values stored on monday for a specific customer account.
examples: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> -a APP_ID -c CLIENT_ACCOUNT_ID -d FILE_FULL_PATH -f FILE_FORMAT

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

appId.description: Select the app that you wish to retrieve the key for
appId.name: appId

fileFormat.description: Optional, file format "CSV" or "JSON" (the default value is "JSON").
fileFormat.name: fileFormat

storage:remove-data.description: Completely remove all the storage data for specific customer account.

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

appId.description: Select the app that you wish to remove account data for
appId.name: appId

storage:search.description: Search keys and values stored on monday for a specific customer account.

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

appId.description: Select the app that you wish to retrieve the key for
appId.name: appId

tunnel:create.description: Create a networking tunnel to publicly expose code running on the local machine.

print-command.description: Print the command that was executed (optional).
print-command.name: print-command

port.description: Port to forward tunnel traffic to.
port.name: port

appId.description: Specify an app id to get a unique tunnel domain for this app.
appId.name: appId
